data.description: Around 60% of IBS patients saw significant pain reduction and 68% experienced bloating reduction with inFoods® IBS Therapy.

data.title: SiriusXM offers to buy back 3.125% Senior Notes due 2026, starts cash tender offer for all outstanding notes.
data.description: On February 26, 2026, Sirius XM Holdings Inc. revealed that its subsidiary, Sirius XM Radio LLC, has initiated a cash tender offer named the "Offer" to buy all of the Offeror's outstanding 3.125% Senior Notes. This offer is a significant move for SiriusXM, a company listed on the NASDAQ under the ticker symbol SIRI. The tender offer represents a key financial decision by the corporation to potentially reduce its outstanding debt and streamline its financial obligations. This development underscores SiriusXM's strategic approach to managing its finances and optimizing its capital structure for future growth and stability.

data.title: Sirius XM Holdings Inc plans to offer $1 billion of Senior Notes due 2032 through its subsidiary.
data.description: In New York on February 26, 2026, Sirius XM Holdings Inc. disclosed plans for its subsidiary, Sirius XM Radio LLC, to issue $1,000,000,000 of Senior Notes due 2032, pending market conditions. This offering is aimed at individuals deemed to be potential investors.

data.title: Global gemstone market expected to reach $72.8 billion by 2036, driven by premium natural stones and demand for proven chain-of-custody and origin.
data.description: The rising demand for premium natural stones is boosting their value in the market, while mass-market synthetics are squeezing profit margins. This trend is prompting investors to focus on companies that can demonstrate transparency in their supply chain, high performance, and authentic origin. In a report released on February 26, 2026, Future Market Insights (FMI) predicts that the global gemstone market will continue to grow.

data.title: Hertz in Estero, FL experiences revenue gains due to transformation efforts - significant growth noted.
data.description: In Estero, Florida, a significant transformation at Hertz has led to notable structural revenue increases and the establishment of sustainable momentum. The company has observed substantial improvements in its financial performance with revenue growing by a significant percentage. This transformation has not only boosted revenue but also enhanced the overall outlook for Hertz, setting a positive trajectory for the company's future.

data.title: Katie Manning appointed as Marketing Manager at Full Sail Partners, a Deltek Platinum Partner. Exciting news from Steamboat Springs!
data.description: Katie Manning, a Certified Professional Services Marketer, has recently been appointed as the Marketing Manager at Full Sail Partners in Steamboat Springs, Colorado on February 26, 2026. The company, known as a Deltek Platinum Partner, looks forward to Manning enhancing market awareness in her new role. This move signifies a strategic step towards growth and development within the company.

data.title: SCYNEXIS starts Phase 1 trial for IV SCY-247, with results expected by 2026.
data.description: Anticipated outcomes from the Phase 1 single ascending dose/multiple ascending dose trial through the intravenous route are projected to be disclosed in the year 2026. The trial aims to assess the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of the investigational drug. This trial involves the participation of a certain number of subjects, including healthy volunteers, and is a crucial step in the drug development process to ensure its effectiveness and safety profile. Analysts are looking forward to analyzing the results to determine the drug's potential for further clinical trials and eventual market approval.

data.title: Hertz Q4 earnings disappoint: -21.15% miss in EPS at $-0.63 vs. $-0.52 estimate, revenue down $12M YoY.
data.description: Hertz Global Holdings (NASDAQ: HTZ) released its Q4 earnings report on Thursday, February 26, 2026, at 08:16 AM. The company fell short of estimated earnings by -21.15%, posting an EPS of $-0.63 compared to an expected $-0.52. Revenue experienced a decrease of $12.00 million from the corresponding period in the prior year. In the previous earnings report, Hertz Global Holdings surpassed expectations. For more details, the full article can be found on Benzinga.com.

data.title: NREF reported Q4 2025 net income of $13.6 million, or 0.52 per diluted share; gives Q1 2026 guidance.
data.description: In Dallas on February 26, 2026, NexPoint Real Estate Finance, Inc. (NREF) announced their financial results for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company disclosed a net income of $13.6 million for common stockholders, equivalent to 0.52 per diluted share. NREF is listed on the NYSE under the ticker symbol NREF.

data.title: Manulife | Comvest Credit Partners leads recapitalization of AC Milan, acting as administrative agent on credit facility.
data.description: In West Palm Beach, Florida, on February 26, 2026, Manulife | Comvest Credit Partners revealed its role as the administrative agent in a credit facility for Associazione Calcio Milan ("AC Milan" or "the club"). The club will be receiving financial support through this arrangement.

data.title: Rithm Property Trust authorizes $10M stock repurchase program by March 1, 2027, under applicable securities laws.
data.description: Rithm Property Trust Inc. (NYSE: RPT) disclosed plans for a $10 million repurchase of the company's Common Stock by March 1, 2027. This decision was approved by the Board of Directors and allows for repurchases through various methods such as open market transactions, privately negotiated deals, or block trades, in adherence to relevant securities laws. The repurchase strategy will also follow regulations outlined in repurchase plans to ensure compliance with governing rules and regulations.

data.title: Quantum Health partners with Lantern to offer value-based specialty care to self-insured employers. Healthcare costs expected to rise 6.5% by 2026.
data.description: In Dublin, Ohio, Quantum Health, a prominent healthcare navigation firm, has revealed a fresh collaboration with Lantern, a value-centered specialty care platform. This partnership broadens the choices accessible to self-insured employers in search of top-notch Centers of Excellence (COEs) and results-oriented specialty care alternatives. Anticipated for 2026 is a noteworthy spike in healthcare expenses for employers, marking the most substantial increase in 15 years at a projected 6.5% surge. Businesses are progressively emphasizing superior...

data.title: CACI plans to issue $500 million senior notes due 2033. Proceeds will be used alongside credit facility borrowings.
data.description: RESTON, Virginia - CACI International Inc (NYSE: CACI) has initiated an offering of $500 million in unsecured senior notes due 2033. The notes, part of the same series as the Company’s 6.375% senior notes due 2033 issued in June 2025, will be used alongside borrowings under its revolving credit facility. This move is aimed at raising funds for unspecified purposes.

data.title: Proxima Fusion, RWE, Bavaria, & IPP to build world's 1st commercial fusion plant in Europe. Stellarator Alpha key.
data.description: A notable fusion energy company, Proxima Fusion, headquartered in Munich, has recently inked a significant deal with the Free State of Bavaria, RWE, and Max Planck Institute for Plasma Physics (IPP). This collaboration aims to establish the world's pioneering commercial stellarator fusion power plant within Europe. The Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) sets out a strategic path towards achieving commercial fusion energy in Europe, starting with the construction of the demonstration stellarator named Alpha. This groundbreaking initiative marks a crucial step forward in the fusion energy sector.

data.title: Burford Capital's Q4 earnings report shows EPS of $-0.17, missing estimated earnings by -144.74%, with revenue down $48.47 million.
data.description: Burford Capital (NYSE: BUR) released its Q4 earnings report on February 26, 2026, at 08:00 AM. The report revealed that the company missed estimated earnings by -144.74%, reporting an EPS of $-0.17 compared to an estimate of $0.38. Additionally, revenue decreased by $48.47 million from the same period last year. This marks a significant decline in performance for the company. More detailed analysis of past earnings and the implications of this latest announcement can be found on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Zscaler likely to report 2Q earnings of 90 cents/share, revenue at $798.92M. Shares rose 4.2% to $155.70. Acquisition announced.
data.description: Zscaler, Inc. (ZS) is set to report its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, Feb. 26, with analysts predicting earnings of 90 cents per share compared to 78 cents per share a year ago. Revenue for the quarter is estimated to be around $798.92 million, an increase from $647.9 million in the previous year. This data is sourced from Benzinga Pro. Additionally, on Feb. 5, Zscaler acquired SquareX. Preceding the earnings release, Zscaler's shares climbed by 4.2%, closing at $155.70 on Wednesday. For further insights into analyst ratings, Benzinga readers can visit the Analyst Stock Ratings page to filter by stock ticker, company name, analyst firm, or rating changes. The complete article can be found on Benzinga.com.

data.title: IGY Marinas renews management agreement for St. Katharine Docks Marina, London, offers charm with 200 years of history.
data.description: MarineMax, Inc., a leading recreational boat and yacht retailer (NYSE: HZO), renewed its management and marketing agreement for St. Katharine Docks Marina in London, England. The agreement was announced by its subsidiary, IGY Marinas, reflecting the company's strong presence in the industry. St. Katharine Docks Marina is a historic nautical destination in London, boasting 200 years of charm. The marina's strategic location in one of the world's renowned cities attracts marine enthusiasts worldwide. This renewal signifies the company's commitment to maintaining and enhancing its portfolio in key global destinations.

data.title: Data Center World 2026 expands program lineup in Washington, D.C., April 20–23, with record-breaking expo floor and new conference experiences.
data.description: A major event in the data center industry, Data Center World, has revealed its 2026 program lineup which is set to take place from April 20-23 at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center in Washington, D.C. The event will focus on positioning the industry in the midst of the AI era and will boast a larger expo floor than ever before. This edition of the event emphasizes "Innovation at Scale" and will showcase new conference experiences and executive forums, aiming to bring together data center experts and thought leaders. With a record-breaking expo floor, the event is expected to draw a significant number of participants and showcase the latest developments in the field.
